article:
I ran in a race over the weekend and re-1earned a valuable lesson.During the middle of the run, I turned a corner and faced a   _  running track--the
kind that doesn't seem to end. When I started the race, the thought of  _  the finish line motivated me.But when 1 was halfway through,out of breath,imagining the finish line didn't provide me with any   _  .
    Instead of focusing on   _  and reaching my goal,I tried to forget all about the finish line and conquering the long running track ahead.I   _  my head and looked
about three steps in front of me. Every three steps became a  _  "finish
line.'' Forget about everything else,I told myself over and over.  Focus on   just those next three steps.  _   I knew it,I had reached the end of the long running track and was   _  another corner.
       So what does this mean in the real world?A11 the experts   _  you to dream big.Making your goals   _  ,they say,will help you persist in the face of difficulties.But many times,this thinking doesn't   _  .
Big goals can become double-edged sword.They can motivate you to take action,but they can also create  _  :I'm in the battle for my life,struggling in the battlefield,and you want me to focus on winning the war? I don't think so.How about focusing on how to  _  the next 24 hours?                             
       There's a fine line of course. If you only focus on what's right in front of you and   _  the bigger picture, your work may start to seem pointless.So what we need is to achieve a(n)  _  .
    People usually say if you're   _  of heights,the rule is not to look down.During my race, I had a new   _  :don't look up.I focused on my next few   _  and knew if I did this over and
over and over.I'd  _  reach the finish line.And I'm happy to report I did finish the race.
